newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani cotton rates mixed on renewed demand.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani cotton rates mixed on renewed demand.

text.p: Pakistani cotton rates were mixed on Sunday amid renewed buying by spinners but dealers said volumes were low and prices could fall amid oversupply.
"Overall the market is bearish. There was some selective buying, but spinners are short of cash and huge stocks are piling up at ginneries, which could pull prices down," dealer Nasim Usman said.
In the kerb market, NIAB-78 variety was traded at 2,050 rupees ($50.96) per maund (37.32 kg), dealers said.
Sunday's official spot rates issued by the Karachi Cotton Association in rupees per maund:
